"Advanced slider" widget
"Advanced slider" widget
- is an interface tool that allows to display various visual elements (grouping elements, widgets, attributes) on a slide. The Advanced Slider combines the capabilities of the following widgets:
Slider
is an element designed to display text and graphic content and switch between slides. The widget assumes manual control and does not contain settings of the automatic slide flipping timer;
Figure
is a widget needed to customize a profile with different information (indicators, graphs, icons, etc.). However, it is not possible to configure the presentation of several profiles and switching between them in the widget.

Analytical setting
The "Advanced slider" widget is configured in the object type profile. To do this, go to visual editing mode and find the desired widget in the tab with the same name in the "Elements" window.
The selected widget should be dragged to the workspace.
Go to the general settings of the widget by clicking the
button.
The widget can be configured using the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Auto width
Logical attribute. When active, it hides the field "Width, px" and allows you to automatically adjust the width of the slider so that it fills all the space of the visual row. The user can choose the height of the widget himself. When inactive, it allows the user to manually adjust the slider size.
Width, px
Specifying the width of the slider in pixels.
Height, px
Specifying the height of the slider in pixels.
Set border radius individually for each corner
Logical attribute. When active, it allows you to specify the rounding for each slider corner individually. In the inactive state it displays the "Corners rounding, px." field.
Corner rounding, px.
Specifying the rounding value for all slider corners.
Border
Selects the format of the sliderâ€™s border.
Thickness, px
Specifying the thickness of the slider border in pixels.
Color
Selecting the border color
Show footer buttons
Setting up the display of switch buttons between slides of the widget.
Show arrows
Setting up the display of side arrows for switching between neighboring slides of the widget.
Automatic slide flipping
A setting that connects the ability to auto-flip between slides with a specified time delay. When active you can set the switching time in the "Slide delay, sec" field. If the setting is disabled, the switching between slides should be done manually.
Slide delay, sec
A numeric field defining the time it takes to switch to the next slide. The setting is displayed when the " Automatic slide flipping" switch is active.
You can delete a slide by clicking the
, button located under the slide name. To create a new slide, click on the
button.
By clicking the
button, the user can open a modal window with the slide settings, where the background is specified.
You can choose a color or a gradient (linear, radial, conical, square) as the background fill.
The user can also upload an image that will be displayed on the slide. When selecting an image, the following options will be available:
setting the image size;
setting the image transparency in percent;
choosing the position of the image within the figure.
Placing objects (widgets and object type attributes) on a slide is possible using visual elements (rows, columns, etc.).
